Class UserProjectileManagerTest

java.lang.Object
Managers.UserProjectileManagerTest
public class UserProjectileManagerTest extends Object
Unit tests for the UserProjectileManager class.

This class validates the functionality of UserProjectileManager, ensuring that the lifecycle and management of user projectiles are handled correctly. It includes tests for retrieving projectiles, verifying the singleton pattern, and firing projectiles.

Source Code: GitHub Link

  • Constructor Details

    • UserProjectileManagerTest

      public UserProjectileManagerTest()

  • Method Details

    • setupJavaFX

      public static void setupJavaFX()
      Initializes the JavaFX platform if it hasn't already been started.

      This method ensures that the JavaFX environment is ready for testing, which is necessary for JavaFX-based classes like UserProjectileManager.

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment before each test.

      This method initializes the root Group and the singleton instance of UserProjectileManager, then fires an initial projectile to ensure the projectile list is not empty.

    • testGetUserProjectiles

      public void testGetUserProjectiles()
      Tests the retrieval of user projectiles.

      This test fires a new projectile, retrieves the list of projectiles, and verifies that the list is not null, not empty, and contains the newly fired projectile.

    • testSingletonPattern

      public void testSingletonPattern()
      Tests the singleton pattern implementation of UserProjectileManager.

      This test verifies that creating a new UserProjectileManager instance with a different root Group returns the same instance as the original.

    • testFireProjectile

      public void testFireProjectile()
      Tests the UserProjectileManager.fireProjectile() method.

      This test verifies that firing a new projectile increases the projectile count and that the newly fired projectile is different from the initial one.
